channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 8 Google Zero-Days Confirmed — Should You Stop Using Chrome?
item.description: Google has now confirmed no fewer than eight zero-day vulnerabilities affecting the Chrome browser this year. Is it time to change your browser?

item.title: Atlantic CEO Nick Thompson on how he learned to ‘just keep moving forward’ after his famous firing at 22
item.description: Thompson was fired on his first—and last—day at CBS News' flagship 60 Minutes. Fifteen years later, he heard what Steve Kroft really thought about it.

item.title: Bessent expects taxpayers will see 'very large' tax refunds early next year
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said American households could receive substantial $1,000-$2,000 tax refunds in early 2026 under OBBBA tax law change...

item.title: iOS 26.2 Or iOS 18.7.3—Here’s Which New iPhone Update To Choose
item.description: Apple has released iOS 26.2 and iOS 18.7.3, fixing iPhone security holes that have been used to perform real-life attacks. So, which iPhone update sho...

item.title: Police have person of interest in custody over Brown University shooting that killed 2, wounded 9
item.description: Separately, an FBI agent said that the arrest occurred at a Hampton Inn hotel in Coventry, about 20 miles from Providence.

item.title: U.S. troops have been on the ground in Syria for over a decade. Here’s the back story and present situation after the deadly Islamic State attack
item.description: The number of U.S. troops in the country has fluctuated and currently stands at around 900.

item.title: FBI Confirms 630 Million Stolen Passwords — How To Check Yours Now
item.description: The FBI has confirmed that 630 million stolen passwords were found on devices belonging to a single hacker. Here's how to check if yours is one of the...

item.title: Everything the Trump administration is doing in Venezuela involves oil and regime change—even if the White House won’t admit it
item.description: The U.S. is weighing its military options in oil-rich Venezuela, influencing elections in other South American petroleum nations, and increasingly try...

item.title: 41 Microsoft Zero-Days — Now Millions Of Users Face Update Choice
item.description: Microsoft users must decide whether Patch Tuesday updates are enough after the Seattle tech behemoth confirmed 41 zero-day vulnerabilities.

item.title: Quordle Hints And Answers For Monday, December 15
item.description: Looking for some help with today’s Quordle words? Some hints and the answers are right here to give you a hand.

item.title: The first-term congressman leading the GOP’s midterm House campaign says Trump is intimately involved in recruitment decisions
item.description: Trump’s involvement contrasts with 2017, when he was not as tied to House leadership, on details of the midterm campaign as he is now.

item.title: Mortgage rates tick higher but remain near 2025 lows
item.description: The average rate on a 30-year fixed mortgage rose this week to 6.22%, according to the latest Freddie Mac data released on Thursday. That is up from l...

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
